Message.Msg: If you roll over the 401k to your own IRA, you have to liquidate all your holdings in the 401k. You basically make it all cash, then transfer that to your own IRA. You don't in general transfer a stock or bond. You create a traditional IRA in your bank or broker, and direct transfer the 401 K money over to it.(do it properly so you get the tax and penalty). I never keep my money with my last employer's 401k. However, there are some small benefits. If you want to borrow against your 401k, you usually have to be still working with the company, otherwise the loan can typically be called much sooner than you may want.

Message.Title: ATT retiree benefits
Message.Msg: Retirees....what are your thoughts on the company not having a healthcare plan in effect for retirees in 2014 and beyond? Are you happy with the large monthly premiums for 2013???? A 500% premium rise........

I will add one consideration since I haven't seen it mentioned. You've probably already addressed it but, if not, check the expense load of the administrator of your existing 401K vs. the rollover options you are considering. It is a key question given what the administrator charges can eat a significant chunk of your annual gains. By the way, they take their cut even when they take a loss with your money. Also, when I set up my IRA in 2006 I found what they propose to charge you is negotiable. At least at that time, they wanted the account & competed for it using the admin cost to do so. Things may have changed on that front, perhaps someone with more recent experience can chime in. Good luck.
Talk to the Prez of your local about that. Ain't that why you pay 2.25 hours to them pizza eaters to fight for you?

More information please Splicer. Where did you get this 2014 cessation of health care plan from? I haven't heard anything about it. I don't how much our 2013 premiums will be yet, but I do know it costs $77.00 monthly currently for me and my wife with Kaiser South Senior Advantage California with catastrophic care included. While premiums have gone up and down over the years, it has never been more than $100.00 for me alone prior to my wife becoming Medicare eligible. With the $72.00 Medicare rebate check I get from State Street (as required by Federal law) every month, I don't consider my plan to be all that bad. If you are aware of the plan being discontinued, kindly post a link.
not true, if you are in t health plan will not be changed 2014 no change in contract will be sign soon.
I'm thinking most of that is made up. I have received nothing to support your post. Do you have any links?

Topic.Title: Tell me they are not crazy

Message.Msg: T needs spectrum to continue growing the business. The market didn't see it as a bad deal. T was down less than the market and Verizon as well as Sprint. In the law of T's big numbers, the amt. spent is chump change. That's my take.

yes. Watch out for that roll over process. You have 60 days to roll over the money. If you do it wrong you get wacked on taxes as they treat the 401k money as a withdrawal and as income, then the IRS hits you with a 10% early withdrawal fee.
